liquidity_profile.highest_liquidity: MAYBANK.KL (RM130.3M daily), TENAGA.KL (RM112.7M daily), YTLPOWR.KL (RM86.6M daily)
liquidity_profile.lowest_liquidity: GASMSIA.KL (RM6.3M daily) - still exceeds minimum requirements

Technology.rationale: Largest tech company by market cap (RM6.42B), exceptional liquidity (RM26M daily), fortress balance sheet (0.18x D/E), highest ROE (16.4%), perfect data quality

Finance.rationale: Second largest bank (RM89.7B), best-in-class fundamentals (0.89% NPL, 16.2% CET1, 12.4% ROE), superior efficiency (32% C/I), highest trading volume, impeccable reporting

Utilities.rationale: National electricity monopoly (RM68.5B), exceptional liquidity (RM112.7M daily), regulated stability, renewable energy transition opportunity, 4.5% dividend yield

risk_profile_assessment.defensive_characteristics: Finance (5) and Utilities (5) provide 71% defensive allocation

checks.actual: Q3 2025 data, 7 days from analysis date
All candidates support RM50K total portfolio with minimal impact

warnings: VSOLAR.KL - Younger listing (2020) means shorter historical data available (4 years vs 5+ years for others), but meets minimum requirements
GASMSIA.KL - Lower liquidity (RM6.3M daily) compared to other candidates; recommend accumulation over 2-3 trading days for RM50K exposure
YTLPOWR.KL and GASMSIA.KL - Higher debt levels (1.45x and 0.68x D/E) reflect infrastructure capex requirements; monitor leverage trends
Technology sector valuation elevated (P/E 19-24x) vs historical averages; fundamental analysis should assess growth-adjusted valuations
MAXIS included in Finance sector allocation as infrastructure/income play despite being telecom; provides 5.8% yield and defensive characteristics
recommendations_for_next_agent: Prioritize fundamental analysis on top-ranked candidates: INARI, PBBANK, MAYBANK, UNISEM, TENAGA, PGAS (scores ≥9.0)
Deep-dive on earnings quality and sustainability for Technology stocks given elevated valuations
Assess dividend sustainability for high-yielders (MAXIS 5.8%, CIMB 5.5%, MAYBANK 5.2%) - calculate payout ratios and FCF coverage
Evaluate balance sheet strength in detail for higher-leverage candidates (YTLPOWR, GASMSIA, MAXIS)
Compare valuation multiples (P/E, P/B, dividend yield) vs 5-year historical ranges and sector peers
Assess ROE trends and decomposition (DuPont analysis) to understand profitability drivers
Consider sector-relative scoring - banks vs banks, tech vs tech, utilities vs utilities for fair comparison
Final portfolio should aim for 8-10 stocks (from current 14) based on fundamental scores and risk-adjusted returns
next_agent_instructions: Perform comprehensive fundamental analysis on all 14 candidates. Score each company on: (1) Earnings Quality & Growth (revenue growth sustainability, earnings consistency, quality of earnings adjustments), (2) Balance Sheet Strength (leverage ratios, working capital, asset quality), (3) Cash Flow Generation (FCF yield, cash conversion, capex sustainability), (4) Profitability (ROE trends, margin analysis, efficiency ratios), (5) Valuation (P/E vs peers/history, P/B, dividend yield, PEG ratio). Create fundamental_scores.json with detailed scores and rankings. Recommend final portfolio of 8-10 stocks with position sizing based on fundamental strength and risk-adjusted returns. Ensure alignment with RM50K capital, medium risk tolerance, and 12-month investment horizon.
